GNS103.question: A newspaper is a publication that is issued:
GNS103.explanation: Newspapers are issued daily or weekly.

GNS103.question: The word library is from a:
GNS103.explanation: The word library comes from the Latin word 'liber' meaning book.

GNS103.question: The word liber means:
GNS103.explanation: Liber is Latin for book.

GNS103.question: National Libraries are also known as:
GNS103.explanation: National libraries serve as depositories for all publications in a country.

GNS103.question: FUTA library is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library is an academic library serving a university.

GNS103.question: The library that acts as national information bank is:
GNS103.explanation: The National Library serves as the national information bank.

GNS103.question: A place where we have large number of historical records is called:
GNS103.explanation: Archives house historical records and documents.

GNS103.question: A library without wall is called:
GNS103.explanation: A virtual library has no physical walls and is accessed online.

GNS103.question: A library that is attached to industrial or corporate organizations is:
GNS103.explanation: Special libraries serve specific organizations with specialized collections.

GNS103.question: A library that is attached to post primary institutions is:
GNS103.explanation: School libraries serve primary and secondary schools.

GNS103.question: Selective dissemination of information is a typical library service performed mostly in the library:
GNS103.explanation: SDI is common in special and academic libraries for researchers.

GNS103.question: International Institute of Tropical Agriculture Library, Ibadan is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: IITA Library is a special library serving agricultural research.

GNS103.question: A library set up according to owner's subject interest is:
GNS103.explanation: Private libraries are owned by individuals based on their interests.

GNS103.question: The following are types of library except:
GNS103.explanation: Education libraries is not a standard library type.

GNS103.question: Libraries owned by an individual are:
GNS103.explanation: Private libraries are owned by individuals.

GNS103.question: The library assigns International Standard Book Number:
GNS103.explanation: National libraries assign ISBNs to publications.

GNS103.question: The _____ is actively involved in inter-library lending schemes in a country:
GNS103.explanation: National libraries coordinate inter-library lending.

GNS103.question: The library type that has collection for all categories of users is:
GNS103.explanation: Public libraries serve all categories of users in a community.

GNS103.question: FUTA Library was opened to users on:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library was opened to users in 1983.

GNS103.question: The library found in the Federal University of Technology was relocated to the present site in:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library was relocated to its present site in April 2006.

GNS103.question: What is the name of FUTA Library?
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library is named Albert Illemobade Library.

GNS103.question: Ondo State Library Board is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: Ondo State Library Board is a public library.

GNS103.question: The type of library that serves undergraduates, graduate students, researchers and faculty is called:
GNS103.explanation: Academic libraries serve the academic community.

GNS103.question: The library that issues ISSN and ISBN is the:
GNS103.explanation: National libraries issue ISSN and ISBN.

GNS103.question: The Federal University of Technology Akure has its library called as:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library is an academic library.

GNS103.question: The university library of FUTA has been renamed to:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library is named Albert Illemobade Library.

GNS103.question: Libraries found in the Central Bank of Nigeria, Nigerian Institute of International Affairs and Shell Development Company are:
GNS103.explanation: These are special libraries serving specific organizations.

GNS103.question: The place and organ that houses and is responsible for the collection and preservation of public and historic resources for use of the public and researchers is called:
GNS103.explanation: Archives preserve historical and public records.

GNS103.question: The National Library of Nigeria was established in:
GNS103.explanation: The National Library of Nigeria was established in 1971.

GNS103.question: _____ is the type of library responsible for collection of legal deposit in Nigeria:
GNS103.explanation: The National Library is responsible for legal deposit.

GNS103.question: An institution saddled with the responsibility of acquisition, processing and preservation of records of enduring value is called:
GNS103.explanation: Archives preserve records of enduring value.

GNS103.question: Albert Illemobade Library FUTA is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library is an academic library.

GNS103.question: The library of the Federal Institute of Industrial Research Oshodi (FIIRO) is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: FIIRO Library is a special library serving industrial research.

GNS103.question: The female cloakroom of the university library when entry is at:
GNS103.explanation: The female cloakroom entry is at the left hand side.

GNS103.question: The acquisition of knowledge and skill using electronic technologies with internet-based course ware and wide range networks is called:
GNS103.explanation: E-Learning uses electronic technologies for education.

GNS103.question: A place where Artefacts materials are organised, kept and made available on requested:
GNS103.explanation: Museums preserve and display artefacts.

GNS103.question: A unique feature of a special library is:
options: It serve all categories of users
It extends its lending to all users
Its collection cut across all disciplines
It serves only the employees of the organization
GNS103.explanation: Special libraries serve only employees of their parent organization.

GNS103.question: A system designed to acquire printed and non-printed information materials, organized and interpret with the aim of providing information to users in solving their information related problems is referred to as:
GNS103.explanation: A library is a system for acquiring, organizing, and providing information.

GNS103.question: A library owned by an individual is an example of a:
GNS103.explanation: A private library is owned by an individual.

GNS103.question: _____ are example of an academic libraries:
options: University libraries, college of education libraries and polytechnics libraries
Polytechnics libraries, college of education libraries and private libraries
GNS103.explanation: Academic libraries serve tertiary institutions.

GNS103.question: All of the following are types of library EXCEPT:
GNS103.explanation: National Archives is not a library type.

GNS103.question: All of these EXCEPT one is not an information sources:
GNS103.explanation: Universal information sources is not a standard category.

GNS103.question: Any library can be categorized using:
GNS103.explanation: Libraries are categorized by ownership, users, and collection type.

GNS103.question: Types of library can depend on the following except:
options: Types of services rendered to users
Types of collections in the library
GNS103.explanation: Gender of users does not determine library type.

GNS103.question: All these are functions of library except:
options: Provision of seating and reading facilities
Keeping of academic records of students
GNS103.explanation: Libraries do not keep academic records of students.

GNS103.question: Opening and closing hours of the University Library, FUTA are:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library opens from 8.00am to 10.00pm.

GNS103.question: Albert Illemobade Library has a publication titled:
options: Guide to the Library to Albert Illemobade Library
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library publishes 'Guide to the Library 2014-2018'.

GNS103.question: FUTA Institutional Repository include all publications collected from inception of the:
options: University Library and kept in one database
University and kept in one database
School and kept in one database
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Institutional Repository contains university publications.

GNS103.question: Media Resources Centres refer to modern:
GNS103.explanation: Media Resources Centres are modern school libraries.

GNS103.question: An archive is a place housing large number of:
GNS103.explanation: Archives house historical records.

GNS103.question: By AD 1543 anatomical drawings were in use in the University of:
GNS103.explanation: Anatomical drawings were used at the University of Padua in 1543.

GNS103.question: The 'Medium is the message' was declared by:
GNS103.explanation: Marshall McLuhan coined the phrase 'The medium is the message'.

GNS103.question: Non-print resources can be categorized into:
options: Audio, Visual, electronic resources and hard copies
GNS103.explanation: Non-print resources include audio, visual, and electronic resources.

GNS103.question: iPod is a mobile device and portable digital player useful for accessing:
GNS103.explanation: iPod is primarily used for audio file formats.

GNS103.question: Podcasts as digitized files can be accessed with the:
GNS103.explanation: Podcasts can be accessed through websites.

GNS103.question: One aspect of information literacy is:
GNS103.explanation: Cultural literacy is an aspect of information literacy.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a primary source of information:
GNS103.explanation: Patents are primary sources of information.

GNS103.question: The largest and most detailed of all encyclopedias is called:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedia Britannica is the largest and most detailed encyclopedia.

GNS103.question: When a source of information is all about a person's life history authored by self it is called:
GNS103.explanation: An autobiography is written by the person about themselves.

GNS103.question: To have reduced photographic images of printed pages and make it possible to house much more materials, the library needs:
GNS103.explanation: Microforms store reduced images of printed pages.

GNS103.question: Which unit in the library is responsible for the processing of books?
GNS103.explanation: Cataloguing and Classification unit processes and organizes books.

GNS103.question: Users normally keep their personal belongings when entering the Library in the:
GNS103.explanation: Users keep belongings in the cloak room.

GNS103.question: The index consulted by library staff to locate serial materials is:
GNS103.explanation: Kardex is a specialized catalogue for serial collections.

GNS103.question: The maximum number of books that undergraduate can borrow in the library is:
GNS103.explanation: Undergraduates can borrow a maximum of 2 books.

GNS103.question: Charging and discharging are performed in _____ unit of the library:
GNS103.explanation: Circulation unit handles charging and discharging of books.

GNS103.question: A book borrowed by undergraduate will be for a period of:
GNS103.explanation: Undergraduates can borrow books for two weeks.

GNS103.question: The followings are ways of acquiring materials in the library except:
GNS103.explanation: Binding is not a method of acquisition, it's preservation.

GNS103.question: The retrieval tool used to locate books on shelves in the library is:
GNS103.explanation: The catalogue is used to locate books on shelves.

GNS103.question: All these are allowed in the library for users except:
GNS103.explanation: Users should not return books to shelves; library staff do shelving.

GNS103.question: A book will have at least _____ numbers of catalogue:
GNS103.explanation: A book has at least three catalogue entries: author, title, subject.

GNS103.question: Registration of users in the library takes place at:
GNS103.explanation: User registration occurs at the circulation unit.

GNS103.question: User education comprises all of the following except:
GNS103.explanation: Reference service is a service, not a form of user education.

GNS103.question: A systematic arrangement or list of bibliographic information is called:
GNS103.explanation: A catalogue is a systematic list of bibliographic information.

GNS103.question: A routine task performed in the acquisitions unit is:
GNS103.explanation: Accessioning is a routine task in the acquisitions unit.

GNS103.question: Providing information on where to get specific information materials is part of the function of _____ unit:
GNS103.explanation: Reference unit provides guidance on locating information.

GNS103.question: The unit mainly stocks postgraduate dissertations and undergraduate projects:
GNS103.explanation: Publications and Repository Unit houses theses and projects.

GNS103.question: _____ is the unit where users are registered:
GNS103.explanation: Circulation unit handles user registration.

GNS103.question: _____ unit is responsible for maintaining security in the library:
GNS103.explanation: Porters' unit maintains security in the library.

GNS103.question: The _____ is the major method of acquiring resources in the Library:
GNS103.explanation: Libraries acquire materials through purchase, gifts, and inter-library loan.

GNS103.question: _____ takes place when a library exchanges some of its materials for the ones it lacks with another library that would have need for them:
GNS103.explanation: Library exchange involves swapping materials between libraries.

GNS103.question: Which of the following departments has among its responsibilities the selection and accessioning of information resources bought by or donated to the library?
GNS103.explanation: Acquisition Unit handles selection and accessioning of resources.

GNS103.question: Cards in a catalogue cabinet are arranged:
GNS103.explanation: Catalogue cards are arranged alphabetically.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a reason why books may be found in the reserved collection:
options: Books are a gift to the library
Books are recommended by teaching staff
GNS103.explanation: Books recommended by teaching staff may be placed on reserve.

GNS103.question: Services offered by the reference department include all except:
GNS103.explanation: Binding is not a reference service.

GNS103.question: Which of these is not a library service:
GNS103.explanation: Libraries do not sell books; book selling is not a library service.

GNS103.question: The primary motive of organizing library materials is to facilitate one of the following:
options: Accessibility and retrieval of library resources
GNS103.explanation: Organization facilitates accessibility and retrieval of resources.

GNS103.question: All except one is not a function of a library catalogue:
options: It assists users to locate a new book written by a familiar author
It helps users to locate books on a particular subject area
It shows the series of a work on a subject
GNS103.explanation: Durability is not a primary function of a catalogue.

GNS103.question: An uncommon situation which the library prepare against its occurrence is:
GNS103.explanation: Libraries prepare for disasters like flood and fire.

GNS103.question: Constant changing of titles is one of the problems of:
GNS103.explanation: Serials often change titles, causing problems.

GNS103.question: _____ directs users to the exact location of a book on the shelf:
GNS103.explanation: Call marks direct users to the exact shelf location.

GNS103.question: The information required for ordering and cataloguing of books include all EXCEPT one of these:
GNS103.explanation: Accession number is assigned after acquisition, not for ordering.

GNS103.question: A process in which all bibliographic information of a particular book are listed in a definite pattern is called:
GNS103.explanation: Bibliographic description lists book information in a definite pattern.

GNS103.question: The Routines in the circulation units in the library is to enable _____ make the best use of the library:
GNS103.explanation: Circulation routines enable users to make best use of the library.

GNS103.question: All except one is not a social media site:
GNS103.explanation: OPAC is a library catalogue, not social media.

GNS103.question: All of the following are types of library catalogue EXCEPT:
GNS103.explanation: Card catalogue is a format, not a type of catalogue arrangement.

GNS103.question: All except one is not a Bibliographic details of an information material:
GNS103.explanation: OPAC is a retrieval tool, not a bibliographic detail.

GNS103.question: All of the following are Printed collections EXCEPT:
GNS103.explanation: E-Resources are electronic, not printed.

GNS103.question: All EXCEPT one is not a classification scheme used in the library:
GNS103.explanation: OPAC is a catalogue, not a classification scheme.

GNS103.question: _____ is the library software used in FUTA library:
GNS103.explanation: SLAM is the library software used in FUTA Library.

GNS103.question: All EXCEPT one is not a storage devices in a computer system:
GNS103.explanation: SLAM is software, not a storage device.

GNS103.question: The Reference unit houses reference materials that are:
GNS103.explanation: Reference materials are for consultation only, not borrowing.

GNS103.question: _____ are reference materials that give general background information on a topic:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedias provide general background information.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of a general encyclopedia:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedia Britannica is a general encyclopedia.

GNS103.question: _____ provide basic data and statistics on topics such as education, health etc and published annually:
GNS103.explanation: Yearbooks provide annual data and statistics.

GNS103.question: Bibliography refers to:
options: A list of works compiled on some common organizing principle
A book containing lists of names of residents, businesses organizations etc
A book of language providing meanings, spellings etc
Material that gives general background information on a topic
GNS103.explanation: Bibliography is a list of works on a common principle.

GNS103.question: Travel guide is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: Travel guides are geographical reference sources.

GNS103.question: A term used for some geographical reference sources is:
GNS103.explanation: Cartographic sources are geographical reference sources.

GNS103.question: Reference sources that provide information on individuals are called:
GNS103.explanation: Biographical sources provide information on individuals.

GNS103.question: Who is who is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: Who's Who is a biographical reference source.

GNS103.question: The reference source that contains synonyms and antonyms with alternate words is called:
GNS103.explanation: A thesaurus provides synonyms and antonyms.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of a fact/ready reference resource:
GNS103.explanation: Directories are fact/ready reference resources.

GNS103.question: _____ is an annual information material containing mostly statistical information on various topics:
GNS103.explanation: Yearbooks contain annual statistical information.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of a literature search tool:
GNS103.explanation: Bibliography is a literature search tool.

GNS103.question: _____ is a geographical dictionary:
GNS103.explanation: A gazetteer is a geographical dictionary.

GNS103.question: One of the following is not a type of index:
GNS103.explanation: Numerical index is not a standard type of index.

GNS103.question: Encyclopedias can be located in _____ unit of the library:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedias are in the reference unit.

GNS103.question: A basic reference collection is made up of all EXCEPT:
GNS103.explanation: Textbooks are not reference materials.

GNS103.question: Nigeria who's who is an example of a:
GNS103.explanation: Who's Who is a biographical reference source.

GNS103.question: Encyclopedia Britannica and Encyclopedia Americana are examples of:
GNS103.explanation: Both are general encyclopedias.

GNS103.question: Which of these options is odd:
GNS103.explanation: Manual is not a geographical source like the others.

GNS103.question: Oxford English dictionary is a:
GNS103.explanation: Oxford English Dictionary is a general dictionary.

GNS103.question: The following are subject dictionaries except:
GNS103.explanation: Longman is a general dictionary, not subject-specific.

GNS103.question: All but one of these resources is available in the Multimedia Unit:
GNS103.explanation: Gazette is not a multimedia resource.

GNS103.question: Which of these options is odd:
GNS103.explanation: Television is electronic, while others are non-electronic visuals.

GNS103.question: Which of these resources can be classified as primary information resources:
GNS103.explanation: Theses and dissertations are primary sources.

GNS103.question: A typical example of an index is:
GNS103.explanation: Library catalogue is a type of index.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a subject reference book:
GNS103.explanation: Dictionary of Proverbs is a subject reference book.

GNS103.question: Publications that give brief and concise information about the content of document especially scientific journals is known as:
GNS103.explanation: Abstracts provide brief summaries of documents.

GNS103.question: Graphic information about the vegetation, relief and population of Ghana can be found in:
GNS103.explanation: Atlases contain graphic geographical information.

GNS103.question: Sketches about important personalities in the world can be obtained from:
GNS103.explanation: Biographical references contain information about personalities.

GNS103.question: List of universities and Higher institutions in West Africa is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: Directories list organizations and institutions.

GNS103.question: Which of these would be good for providing background information on a topic:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedias provide background information.

GNS103.question: To find facts and statistics about a country, I would need to search in:
GNS103.explanation: Almanacs contain facts and statistics.

GNS103.question: To find if 'shroud' is a noun, adverb, adjective etc:
GNS103.explanation: Dictionaries provide word classifications.

GNS103.question: To find a long detailed description of the United States of America:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedias provide detailed descriptions of countries.

GNS103.question: To find the locations of cities, states and river:
GNS103.explanation: Atlases contain maps showing locations.

GNS103.question: To find last year's winners of the academy awards:
GNS103.explanation: Almanacs contain annual event information.

GNS103.question: To find the longitude and latitude of Lagos, Nigeria:
GNS103.explanation: Atlases contain geographical coordinates.

GNS103.question: To find how to pronounce the word 'Cygnet':
GNS103.explanation: Dictionaries provide pronunciation guides.

GNS103.question: _____ is a collection of maps:
GNS103.explanation: An atlas is a collection of maps.

GNS103.question: Most serials especially journals are acquired through:
GNS103.explanation: Serials are usually acquired through subscription.

GNS103.question: One of the factors that affect the production and acquisition of serials is:
GNS103.explanation: Constant title changes affect serial production and acquisition.

GNS103.question: A major advantage of Electronic Serials is that:
options: They can also be accessed from outside the library
On-line articles are difficult to access
GNS103.explanation: Electronic serials can be accessed remotely from anywhere.

GNS103.question: The following are advantages of using Non-print resources except:
GNS103.explanation: Erratic power supply is a disadvantage, not an advantage.

GNS103.question: One of the following is not part of audio-visual resources:
GNS103.explanation: World Atlas is a print/geographic resource, not audio-visual.

GNS103.question: Books as the oldest forms of printed media include the following sub types except:
GNS103.explanation: Realia are real objects, not printed media.

GNS103.question: Cartographic materials are also known as:
GNS103.explanation: Cartographic materials are maps and related geographical items.

GNS103.question: Transparency is an example of _____ form of recording knowledge:
GNS103.explanation: Transparency is a non-print form of recording knowledge.

GNS103.question: Advantages of non-prints include the followings except:
GNS103.explanation: Technology obsolescence is a disadvantage of non-print resources.

GNS103.question: A journal can be found in _____ unit of a library:
GNS103.explanation: Journals are kept in the serials unit.

GNS103.question: ISSN means:
GNS103.explanation: ISSN stands for International Standard Serial Number.

GNS103.question: An information material published in successive parts and intended to continue indefinitely is called:
GNS103.explanation: Serials, magazines, and periodicals all fit this definition.

GNS103.question: _____ is not a characteristic of serials:
options: It contains International Standard Book Number
GNS103.explanation: Serials have ISSN, not ISBN.

GNS103.question: An information material containing between five and forty-eight pages is known as:
GNS103.explanation: A pamphlet contains 5-48 pages.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of a miniature storage medium:
GNS103.explanation: Memory card is a miniature storage medium.

GNS103.question: A publication issued in successive parts at regular or irregular intervals, intended to be continued indefinitely are:
GNS103.explanation: Serials are publications issued in successive parts indefinitely.

GNS103.question: Which of these resources is the odd one out?
GNS103.explanation: Dictionaries are reference materials, not serials.

GNS103.question: Which of these resources are published as volumes and issues/numbers, possess ISSN and contain articles?
GNS103.explanation: Newspapers are serials with ISSN.

GNS103.question: The Punch is a:
GNS103.explanation: The Punch is a daily newspaper.

GNS103.question: Guardian newspaper belongs to the class of materials called:
GNS103.explanation: Newspapers are serials.

GNS103.question: All of the following are reference materials except:
GNS103.explanation: Serials are not reference materials.

GNS103.question: Periodicals are identified by a number referred to as:
GNS103.explanation: Periodicals are identified by ISSN.

GNS103.question: A distinguishing factor of a Journal is its:
GNS103.explanation: Journals are distinguished by volume and issue numbers.

GNS103.question: Personal Digital Assistant can be used to organize one's:
options: Company's appointments, tasks, address lists telephone information
Ones business or personal schedules, calendar, addresses and book information
Students' overall information while in their institutions of learning
GNS103.explanation: PDA helps organize personal schedules and information.

GNS103.question: Which one of the following is an odd-man-out?
GNS103.explanation: Geomorphological is too specific; others are general categories.

GNS103.question: One of the following is not an audio visual material:
GNS103.explanation: Monographs are print materials.

GNS103.question: All except one of these library materials is a serial publication:
GNS103.explanation: Atlas is a book, not a serial.

GNS103.question: One of these library materials is a primary source of information:
GNS103.explanation: Scientific journals contain primary research.

GNS103.question: Kardex is a specialise catalogue use for:
GNS103.explanation: Kardex is used for serial collections.

GNS103.question: All these are characteristics of serials except:
options: They are often acquired through subscription
The content in each volume differs from another
GNS103.explanation: Serials are published successively by definition.

GNS103.question: Advantages of using electronic serials include these except:
options: E-serials are easy to read and revise
They cannot be access within library
They can be accessed by many users at the same time
GNS103.explanation: E-serials can be accessed within the library too.

GNS103.question: All of the following are types of audio-visual materials EXCEPT:
GNS103.explanation: Furniture is not an audio-visual material.

GNS103.question: All EXCEPT one are reference materials that gives geographical information to users:
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopaedia is not primarily a geographical source.

GNS103.question: All EXCEPT one are types periodical information materials in the library:
GNS103.explanation: Library users manuals are not periodicals.

GNS103.question: One of the common features of a dictionary catalogue is:
options: Entries are interfiled in alphabetical sequence
GNS103.explanation: Dictionary catalogue interfiles all entries alphabetically.

GNS103.question: One of the filing methods in the library is:
GNS103.explanation: Word by word is a filing method.

GNS103.question: Journals are preferred for research because:
options: They contain up-to-date information of a technical nature
They contain general information for public consumption
GNS103.explanation: Journals provide current, technical research information.

GNS103.question: Information in journals have all of the following characteristics except:
GNS103.explanation: Journals contain technical, not general interest information.

GNS103.question: Most scholarly journals are published by:
options: Internet and the World Wide Web
GNS103.explanation: Scholarly journals are published by academic institutions and professional bodies.

GNS103.question: 'Popular' articles for general readership can be found in:
GNS103.explanation: Magazines contain popular articles for general readership.

GNS103.question: Which of these is a subject encyclopedia?
GNS103.explanation: Encyclopedia of Genetic Engineering is a subject encyclopedia.

GNS103.question: One of this is common to Magazines, Journals and Newspapers:
GNS103.explanation: Serial publications have volume and issue numbers.

GNS103.question: You have been asked to find articles that discuss a political issue currently being debated in the media. What type of source should you look for?
GNS103.explanation: Daily newspapers cover current political issues.

GNS103.question: Journal articles can be found in all of the following places except:
GNS103.explanation: General Reading Room typically houses books, not journals.

GNS103.question: The display of newly acquired information materials in the library is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: Display of new materials is a current awareness service.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of a graphic material:
GNS103.explanation: Chart is a graphic material.

GNS103.question: A book is an information material containing _____ pages:
GNS103.explanation: A book contains 49 pages or more.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of an audio-visual material:
GNS103.explanation: Television is an audio-visual material.

GNS103.question: _____ are good source of primary information:
GNS103.explanation: Journals are primary sources of information.

GNS103.question: To identify a serial, it must have:
GNS103.explanation: Serials are identified by volume and issue numbers.

GNS103.question: Another name given to yearbook is:
GNS103.explanation: Yearbooks are also called annuals.

GNS103.question: The skills combined in locating and retrieving information is called:
GNS103.explanation: Information literacy involves skills for locating and retrieving information.

GNS103.question: Physical parts of a book consist of the following except:
GNS103.explanation: Publisher is a bibliographic element, not a physical part.

GNS103.question: Binding is:
options: That part of a book which holds the printed sheets together
The edge of the book that holds the printed sheets together
A blank leaf found at the beginning and end of a book
GNS103.explanation: Binding holds the printed sheets together.

GNS103.question: Copyright page is also known as:
GNS103.explanation: The copyright page is the verso page.

GNS103.question: The unique 10 or 13 digit identification number assigned to editions of books by the publisher is:
GNS103.explanation: ISBN identifies book editions.

GNS103.question: The call number or location number is combination of:
GNS103.explanation: Call number combines subject number and author number.

GNS103.question: A running number carried by each library book indicating when it was acquired into the collection of the library is called:
GNS103.explanation: Accession number indicates when a book was acquired.

GNS103.question: The name of the Federal University of Technology, Akure Library is:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library is named Albert Illemobade Library.

GNS103.question: To evaluate a website, factors to be considered include all but:
options: Name of organization/institution the website is affiliated to
GNS103.explanation: Currency is a factor to consider, not an exception.

GNS103.question: When classifying a book, one can get information about the nature, purpose and scope of the book from its:
GNS103.explanation: The preface explains the nature, purpose, and scope of the book.

GNS103.question: Classification schemes include the following except:
GNS103.explanation: Bloom's Taxonomy is for educational objectives, not library classification.

GNS103.question: Collation in a typical catalogue card entry gives information such as:
GNS103.explanation: Collation includes pagination, illustrations, and size.

GNS103.question: Information literacy involves the abilities that require a person to:
options: Identify when a particular information is needed
Have the ability to locate the needed information
Use effectively and efficiently the information
GNS103.explanation: Information literacy includes all these abilities.

GNS103.question: Collections in a Reference Unit can be identified by an acronym known as:
GNS103.explanation: REF identifies reference collections.

GNS103.question: GNS 103: Information Retrieval course is designed by university to achieve all of the following except:
options: Make librarian out of the students
Inculcate information skills in the students so that they can become life long learners
Teach students the importance of information to their academic pursuit
GNS103.explanation: The course aims to develop information skills, not make students librarians.

GNS103.question: A user of University Library Federal University of Technology Akure intending to use the Library of Adekunle Ajasin University Library must:
options: Letter of introduction from his library
GNS103.explanation: A letter of introduction from the home library is required.

GNS103.question: One of the following statement is not true about library catalogue:
options: Library catalogue contains list of all the library materials in the library
Catalogue is to keep records of all the materials in the library for posterity
To serve as search tool for retrieving information material available in the library without wasting their time
Library catalogue gives information about author, title and subject to enhance quick retrieval of information materials
GNS103.explanation: Catalogue is for retrieval, not just posterity.

GNS103.question: All but one of the following reasons is not associated with copyright date:
options: To ascertain the year the book is published
To ascertain the recency of the publication
It serves as selection criteria for selection of book to be acquired
To know when copyright date expires
GNS103.explanation: Copyright date doesn't indicate expiry; it's the publication year.

GNS103.question: _____ is the Classification Scheme adopted by the University Library Federal University of Technology, Akure for organisation of their materials:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library uses Library of Congress Classification.

GNS103.question: Which of the following statement is not true about social media as information service delivery media:
GNS103.explanation: Social media should not be used for disseminating pornographic information.

GNS103.question: One of these services is not rendered by the university library Federal University of Technology Akure:
GNS103.explanation: Services to physically challenged may not be available at FUTA Library.

GNS103.question: Theses and dissertations are _____ sources of information:
GNS103.explanation: Theses and dissertations are primary sources.

GNS103.question: 'Fair use' in copyrighted works is:
options: To allow researcher to make use of part of work for academic purpose only
Allow researchers to copy the whole work for academic purposes only
To allow the work be used for any purpose without authorization
GNS103.explanation: Fair use allows limited use for academic purposes.

GNS103.question: The acronym OPAC means:
GNS103.explanation: OPAC stands for Online Public Access Catalogue.

GNS103.question: All these are allowed in the library except:
GNS103.explanation: Group discussion is not allowed in the library.

GNS103.question: All these are forms of damage to library books except:
GNS103.explanation: Binding is preservation, not damage.

GNS103.question: The type of library catalogue is:
GNS103.explanation: Divided catalogue is a type of catalogue arrangement.

GNS103.question: The classification scheme used in FUTA library is:
GNS103.explanation: FUTA Library uses Library of Congress Classification.

GNS103.question: The acronym 'http' means:
GNS103.explanation: HTTP stands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol.

GNS103.question: All these are search engines except:
GNS103.explanation: Hyper is not a search engine.

GNS103.question: All these are browsers except:
GNS103.explanation: Exposure is not a web browser.

GNS103.question: In library of congress classification scheme 'R' represents:
GNS103.explanation: R represents Medicine in LC classification.

GNS103.question: A number 86-013575 on a catalogue card represents:
GNS103.explanation: This format typically represents an accession number.

GNS103.question: Factors to be considered when evaluating internet materials include these except:
GNS103.explanation: Price is not a factor in evaluating internet materials.

GNS103.question: 'www' represents in ICT word:
GNS103.explanation: WWW stands for World Wide Web.

GNS103.question: The supplementary information that may be useful to a reader is:
GNS103.explanation: Appendices contain supplementary information.

GNS103.question: A reader can use the university library only if he/she has:
options: Formally given admission by the university
Formally introduced as a FUTA student
GNS103.explanation: Library registration is required to use the library.

GNS103.question: _____ is not a type of library catalogue:
GNS103.explanation: Card catalogue is a format, not a type.

GNS103.question: _____ is an example of an internet service:
GNS103.explanation: All are internet services.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a service performed in the library:
GNS103.explanation: Current awareness service is a library service.

GNS103.question: Internet telephony allows voice calls using:
GNS103.explanation: Internet telephony works on all internet-enabled devices.

GNS103.question: Web log is another name for:
GNS103.explanation: Web log is shortened to blog.

GNS103.question: One of the following is not a function of a library catalogue:
options: It identifies the work of editors only
It gives index to the library collection
It describes the materials in the library
GNS103.explanation: Catalogue identifies more than just editors' works.

GNS103.question: _____ is one of the greatest offence in the library:
GNS103.explanation: Eating is a serious offence in the library.

GNS103.question: _____ and _____ are one of the routine duties of a librarian:
GNS103.explanation: Shelving and shelf-reading are routine librarian duties.

GNS103.question: The act of impacting library instructional skills and use to students is called:
GNS103.explanation: User education teaches library skills to users.

GNS103.question: A process in which all bibliographic information and other related information about any book are accessed through computer terminal is called:
GNS103.explanation: OPAC provides computer access to bibliographic information.

GNS103.question: The commonest classification scheme used in most academic library is:
GNS103.explanation: LC is common in academic libraries.

GNS103.question: As general good preservation practices for library materials that are in poor state, the library staff has the obligation to:
options: Benefit from information literacy on proper handlings of books
Purchase back-up types of electronic library materials
Allow the materials to gather dust
GNS103.explanation: Damaged materials should be withdrawn for repair.

GNS103.question: As part of specific rules for the library, the library user who loses any library material will pay the cost of the material plus administrative charge of:
GNS103.explanation: Lost materials incur 15% administrative charge.

GNS103.question: The internet telephony is voice over:
GNS103.explanation: Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP).

GNS103.question: The checklist for research evaluation include all except:
GNS103.explanation: Injectibility is not a research evaluation criterion.

GNS103.question: When a researcher cites an electronic source he/she should have a copy of the material because:
options: Internet-based materials are short-lived on the web
Internet can be affected by power outage
The author of the material may not be known
GNS103.explanation: Web content may disappear, so keep copies.

GNS103.question: The Library of Congress Classification Scheme is divided into _____ main classes:
GNS103.explanation: LC has 21 main classes.

GNS103.question: The Dewey Decimal Classification Scheme is used mainly by _____ libraries:
GNS103.explanation: DDC is used mainly by small libraries.

GNS103.question: The International Standard Book Number is assigned by the:
GNS103.explanation: National libraries assign ISBNs.

GNS103.question: Some methods of acquiring information resources in the library are:
GNS103.explanation: All are methods of acquisition.

GNS103.question: The Dust jacket contains the:
GNS103.explanation: The dust jacket contains the blurb.

GNS103.question: In order to connect professional and develop better relationships, the social media that can be used include:
GNS103.explanation: Facebook can be used for professional networking.

GNS103.question: To share information of professional interest and career experiences, it is better to use:
GNS103.explanation: LinkedIn is for professional networking.

GNS103.question: Some disadvantages of the use of social media are:
GNS103.explanation: All are disadvantages of social media.

GNS103.question: File transfer protocol an internet standard permits on the internet the sharing of _____ with other computers:
GNS103.explanation: FTP allows file sharing.

GNS103.question: A library with manual and electronic catalogues is an example of one that uses:
GNS103.explanation: Hybrid catalogue combines manual and electronic.

GNS103.question: Added entries can be used in locating publication by the provision of:
options: Title, subject, author, translator, compiler and publisher
Title, subject, author, compiler and press
Title, subject, author, publisher, printer and press
GNS103.explanation: Added entries include these access points.

GNS103.question: Call number is:
GNS103.explanation: Call numbers are alphanumeric.

GNS103.question: The unique number assigned to any book showing when it was acquired is called:
GNS103.explanation: Accession number shows acquisition order.

GNS103.question: Information on the publisher of a book, place and date of publication is known as:
GNS103.explanation: Imprint contains publisher, place, and date.

GNS103.question: Information on a book's length and size as well as notations about maps or illustrations is called:
GNS103.explanation: Collation describes physical characteristics.

GNS103.question: Date of copyright, name of copyright holder, book's number, library of congress catalogue number, previous editions, printers name can all be found on the:
GNS103.explanation: Copyright page contains all this information.

GNS103.question: Sources of information when listed and arranged in an alphabetical order can be referred to as:
GNS103.explanation: Bibliography is an alphabetical list of sources.

GNS103.question: An additional explanations and elaboration not essential to a text is known as:
GNS103.explanation: Appendix contains supplementary material.

GNS103.question: In the Dewey Decimal System, 300 represents:
GNS103.explanation: 300 represents Social Sciences in DDC.

GNS103.question: In the Library of Congress system, V stands for:
GNS103.explanation: V represents Naval Science.

GNS103.question: _____ represents social sciences in the Library of Congress System:
GNS103.explanation: H represents Social Sciences in LC.

GNS103.question: MARC can be used only by:
GNS103.explanation: MARC can be used by many libraries.

GNS103.question: A good report should have one of the following:
GNS103.explanation: A good report should have references.

GNS103.question: When citing for scholarly publications one of the following is not required:
GNS103.explanation: Bibliography is the list, not required in every citation.

GNS103.question: A good report basically has the following section EXCEPT one:
GNS103.explanation: Flyer is not a section of a report.

GNS103.question: All EXCEPT one are sources of information in a report writing:
GNS103.explanation: Bookshop is a place to buy, not a source.

GNS103.question: Which of the following best describes Information literacy?
options: The ability to define an information need and satisfy it
GNS103.explanation: Information literacy is defining and satisfying information needs.

GNS103.question: To find ALL books a library has on Cost analysis, one needs to consult the:
GNS103.explanation: Subject catalogue lists books by subject.

GNS103.question: To find materials on the shelf in the library, one would need to use:
GNS103.explanation: Call number directs to shelf location.

GNS103.question: Which is not true about scholarly journals?
options: The articles usually have citations and references
The information is usually technical in nature
The articles are usually authored by journalists
GNS103.explanation: Scholarly journals are authored by experts, not journalists.

GNS103.question: Which of this is NOT part of a citation?
GNS103.explanation: Call number is for shelf location, not citation.

GNS103.question: A common reference style used by students is:
GNS103.explanation: APA is a common citation style.

GNS103.question: An article abstract is:
options: The full text of an article
Information about where the article can be found
GNS103.explanation: An abstract summarizes the article.

GNS103.question: Which of the following would not be considered a primary source material?
options: A 1975 newspaper on the political situation of Nigeria
A report from a study about students use of Social media
An article in a journal about the effectiveness of a nutritional supplement
A chapter in a course book that discusses information literacy
GNS103.explanation: A course book chapter is a secondary source.

GNS103.question: Using call numbers, books are arranged on the shelves based on:
GNS103.explanation: Call numbers arrange books by subject.

GNS103.question: Plagiarism is:
options: Including other people's ideas in your write-up
Using someone's ideas in your paper but not crediting the source
Acknowledging the source of any information cited
Including only primary sources in your write-up
GNS103.explanation: Plagiarism is using others' work without credit.

GNS103.question: Which of the following should be the least important consideration when developing a topic for your assignment?
options: It meets the requirement of the assignment
It will be interesting to you and your readers
Enough high quality sources are available
GNS103.explanation: Personal values are least important in topic selection.

GNS103.question: Miniature mobile storage media are flash drives, memory cards, USB and smart cards:
GNS103.explanation: These are all miniature storage media.

GNS103.question: _____ treat specific subjects like agriculture, medicine etc:
GNS103.explanation: Subject encyclopedias focus on specific fields.

GNS103.question: Which of the following statements is true:
options: Only experts can publish Web pages
An author's motivations can impact the information that he/she publishes on the Web
GNS103.explanation: Author motivations affect web content.

GNS103.question: The URL address: http://www.epa.gov/climatechange shows that the website:
options: Is published by an educational institution
Is published by a government agency
GNS103.explanation: .gov indicates a government website.

GNS103.question: The URL address: http://ui.edu.ng/content/centres-excellence shows that the website:
options: Is published by an educational institution
Is published by a government agency
GNS103.explanation: .edu indicates an educational institution.

GNS103.question: Which of the following is not a reason to cite your sources?
options: They lend authority to your work
They let readers retrieve sources that you have cited
They give credit to the cited sources
They increase the grade of the author
GNS103.explanation: Citing sources doesn't automatically increase grade.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a subject reference book:
GNS103.explanation: Dictionary of Proverbs is a subject reference book.

GNS103.question: One of the ways of acquiring information in the library is:
GNS103.explanation: Bequest is a method of acquisition.

GNS103.question: The reference unit is a place in the library where the following materials except one are organised for consultation:
GNS103.explanation: Journals are in serials unit, not reference.

GNS103.question: Word entries are arranged alphabetically in the following materials except:
GNS103.explanation: All are arranged alphabetically.

GNS103.question: These sources provide basic data and statistics on topics such as education, health, sports, personalities or professions and are usually published annually:
GNS103.explanation: Almanacs and yearbooks provide annual statistics.

GNS103.question: _____ is a list of the books of a specific author, publisher or on a specific subject:
GNS103.explanation: Bibliography lists books on specific criteria.

GNS103.question: Geographical sources are also known as cartographic sources:
GNS103.explanation: Geographical sources are also called cartographic sources.

GNS103.question: Works on a single subject or aspect of a subject are called:
GNS103.explanation: Monographs are works on a single subject.

GNS103.question: These resources appeal strictly to the sense of sight except:
GNS103.explanation: All appeal to sight only.

GNS103.question: These information resources combine the qualities of sight and sound appear in one media:
GNS103.explanation: Television combines sight and sound.

GNS103.question: What are the four steps involved in report writing?
GNS103.explanation: Report writing steps: Think, plan, write, revise.

GNS103.question: What is an executive summary used for in a report?
options: To grab the attention of the reader
To discourage further reading of the main report
To reduce the number of the pages of the report
GNS103.explanation: Executive summary grabs reader attention.

GNS103.question: The sections in a report are arranged in this order:
options: Body of report, Introduction, title page, conclusion, table of contents
Table of contents, title page, conclusion, Introduction, body of report
Title page, abstract, introduction, body of report, conclusion, references
Title page, abstract, body of report, conclusion, references, introduction
GNS103.explanation: This is the standard report structure.

GNS103.question: In report writing, recommendations are based on:
GNS103.explanation: Recommendations are based on findings.

GNS103.question: In APA style, in-text citation consists of:
GNS103.explanation: APA in-text citation uses author and year.

GNS103.question: Each source listed in the reference list must be cited in the:
GNS103.explanation: All references must be cited in the text.

GNS103.question: Which of the following is the correct APA Reference list entry?
options: Reese G. (2000). Database Programming with JDBC and Java. Beijing: O'Reilly Media
Reese G. Database Programming with JDBC and Java. Beijing: O'Reilly Media (2000)
Database Programming with JDBC and Java. Beijing: O'Reilly Media. Reese G. (2000)
Reese G. (2000). Beijing: O'Reilly Media. Database Programming with JDBC and Java
GNS103.explanation: This follows APA format: Author (Year). Title. Place: Publisher.

GNS103.question: In the University Library, one can use SLAM to identify all of the following except:
options: The number of books on a specific subject
The availability of a particular title
The books published by a particular author
The librarian who classified the book
GNS103.explanation: SLAM doesn't identify who classified the book.

GNS103.question: The least important factor to consider when evaluating an informational website for use in a research paper is:
GNS103.explanation: Font size is not a critical evaluation factor.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a primary source of information:
GNS103.explanation: Patents are primary sources.

GNS103.question: An Act of parliament is an example of:
GNS103.explanation: Acts of parliament are government publications.

GNS103.question: One of the following library materials is a primary source of information:
GNS103.explanation: Scientific journals contain primary research.

GNS103.question: Thesis and dissertations are _____ sources of information:
GNS103.explanation: Theses and dissertations are primary sources.

GNS103.question: Education is not only an instrument of social change but viewed as:
options: An investment in the national development
Necessary for the health and shelter
GNS103.explanation: Education is an investment in national development.

GNS103.question: Secondary information sources are:
options: Created from primary materials interpreting original material
GNS103.explanation: Secondary sources interpret primary sources.

GNS103.question: The term study skill is used for:
options: General approaches to learning skills for specific courses of study
GNS103.explanation: Study skills are approaches to learning.

GNS103.question: One of the following is the role of the library resources in education:
options: Library enables the individual to obtain spiritual inspiration
Provide educators with access to relevant curriculum
GNS103.explanation: Libraries provide educators access to curriculum materials.

GNS103.question: Among other things, study skills include mnemonics which help in:
GNS103.explanation: Mnemonics aid information retention.

GNS103.question: GNS 103: Information Retrieval course is designed by university to achieve all of the following except:
options: Make librarian out of the students
Inculcate information skills in the students
Teach students the importance of information
GNS103.explanation: The course aims to develop skills, not make librarians.

GNS103.question: The following are the features of books except:
GNS103.explanation: Volume number is for serials, not books.

GNS103.question: A bulletin issued periodically to a group of defined individuals of a society, business or organization is known as:
GNS103.explanation: Newsletters are issued to specific groups.

GNS103.question: Current Awareness Services include all the following except:
GNS103.explanation: Translation services are not current awareness services.

GNS103.question: With advancing technologies, OPAC, MARC and others, library users can be in the world:
GNS103.explanation: Anyone can access library resources online.

GNS103.question: Libraries found in primary and secondary schools are classified as:
GNS103.explanation: Primary and secondary schools have school libraries.

GNS103.question: Gazetteer can be located at which of these sections of the library:
GNS103.explanation: Gazetteers are often in government documents section.

GNS103.question: In the Dewey Decimal Classification, 300 stands for:
GNS103.explanation: 300 represents Social Sciences in DDC.

GNS103.question: Names and addresses of women organizations in Nigeria can be found in:
GNS103.explanation: Directories list organizations and addresses.

GNS103.question: The age, qualifications and experience of Mohammad Buhari could best be found in:
GNS103.explanation: Who's Who contains biographical information on living persons.

GNS103.question: Undergraduate project can be obtained from:
GNS103.explanation: Undergraduate projects are in the documents unit.

GNS103.question: The prefix 'J' is a class mark that represents library materials under:
GNS103.explanation: J represents Political Science in LC classification.

GNS103.question: Information materials on technology are classified under:
GNS103.explanation: T represents Technology in LC classification.

GNS103.question: A paper designed to cover a published book is called:
GNS103.explanation: Dust jacket covers a published book.

GNS103.question: One of the following is not a service performed in academic libraries:
GNS103.explanation: Bindery service may not be in all academic libraries.

GNS103.question: Another name for information literacy is:
GNS103.explanation: Information literacy is also called information retrieval.

GNS103.question: The following are aspects of information literacy except:
GNS103.explanation: Print sources are formats, not an aspect of literacy.

GNS103.question: One of the following is a bibliographic part of a book:
GNS103.explanation: Title is a bibliographic element.

GNS103.question: _____ is a physical part of a book:
GNS103.explanation: Book cover is a physical part.

GNS103.question: Another term for real object is:
GNS103.explanation: Realia are real objects.

GNS103.question: An information resource containing list of names of residents or organisations in a place is known as:
GNS103.explanation: Directories list names and addresses.

GNS103.question: An information resource published in successive parts and contains information is called a:
GNS103.explanation: All terms refer to publications in successive parts.

GNS103.question: The Porters' Unit among other things:
options: See to the security of all library materials
Check people as they come into the library and go out of the library
GNS103.explanation: Porters perform all these security functions.
